Vehicle Overview

What it is: The Q70L is the long-wheelbase version of the Q70. At 120.1 inches, the wheelbase is 5.9 inches longer than the standard Q70 for more backseat legroom. Like the regular-wheelbase Q70, the Q70L is powered by a 3.7-liter V-6 or a 5.6-liter V-8 engine.
What’s Special

5.1 inches of additional rear legroom
Rear- or all-wheel drive
Auto-cinching rear doors

Here’s Info on the Regular Q70:
What it is: The Infiniti Q70 luxury sedan is offered in standard- and long-wheelbase versions, as well as a standard-wheelbase-only hybrid. The base engine is a 3.7-liter V-6, but a 5.6-liter V-8 is available. Rear- and all-wheel drive models are offered and the Q70 competes against the Audi A6, Mercedes-Benz E-Class and BMW 5 Series.

(Skip to details on the Q70 Hybrid)
New for 2017
The Premium Select Edition, a trim package introduced on the standard-wheelbase sedan last year, is now available on the long-wheelbase models. It includes unique interior and exterior trim, 20-inch alloy wheels and a rear spoiler.
Significant Standard Features

330-horsepower, 3.7-liter V-6 engine
Seven-speed automatic transmission
Rear-wheel drive
Wood trim
Heated front seats
Dual-zone automatic air conditioning
7-inch color information display
Keyless entry with push-button start
Backup camera
Required in every new car: front airbags, antilock brakes and an electronic stability system

Significant Available Features

420-hp, 5.6-liter V-8
All-wheel drive
Adaptive front-lighting system
Leather upholstery
Ventilated front seats
Navigation system
Heated steering wheel
Surround-view camera system
Bose surround-sound premium stereo
Forward collision warning with emergency braking
Lane departure warning and prevention
Blind spot warning system

Q70 Hybrid
The Q70 Hybrid is powered by a 3.5-liter V-6 engine and a 50-kilowatt electric motor. Infiniti claims its testing has shown that, in mixed driving, the Q70 Hybrid can drive on electric power for up to 50 percent of the time.
What’s Special

EPA-estimated 29/34/31 mpg city/highway/combined
Lithium-ion battery pack powers electric motor
360-hp total system output
Rear-wheel drive only

2019.expert_review:
What Is the 2019 Infiniti Q70?

The 2019 Infiniti Q70 is a mid-size luxury sedan that can seat up to five people. It comes standard with a 330-horsepower, 3.7-liter V-6 engine; a 416-hp, 5.6-liter V-8 is optional. Both engines work with a seven-speed automatic transmission. Rear- and all-wheel-drive models are offered, along with a long-wheelbase Q70L. Competitors include the Audi A6, Mercedes-Benz E-Class and BMW 5 Series.

What's New on the 2019 Infiniti Q70?

New standard features include built-in navigation, a Bose premium stereo, a 360-degree camera system, front and rear parking sensors, leather upholstery and a heated steering wheel.

What Features in the 2019 Infiniti Q70 Are Most Important?

Available all-wheel drive should give drivers concerned with winter traction extra peace of mind, while the optional V-8 engine should appeal to performance enthusiasts. Besides the new standard features mentioned above, the Q70 also has a standard power moonroof, heated and cooled front seats, ash wood trim, satellite radio, Bluetooth streaming audio, dual-zone automatic air conditioning and a power-adjustable steering column. Optional active safety features include predictive forward collision warning, lane departure warning and prevention, automatic emergency braking and a blind spot warning system.

Should I Buy the 2019 Infiniti Q70?

Certain areas of the Q70, like the instrument panel, are showing the car's age, but the sedan still offers a luxurious cabin and the available V-8 is powerful. We also like the extra backseat room in the Q70L. However, if you're interested in the latest driver-assist technology, one of the Q70's competitors might suit you better.
